DATA APPENDIX In this appendix we explain how we reconcile the codes for major field of study and industry to obtain consistent classifications over time.

The census master files report the major field of study variable based on the Major Field of Study (MFS) classification from 1986 to 2001, and the Classification of Instructional Programs (CIP) in 2006. To take into account this change, we use the concordance between MFS and CIP downloaded from the Statistics Canada website,28 and report the results at the major levels of the MFS. However, because the CIP has a more detailed classification than the MFS, there are 170 CIP categories with more than one MFS major level. To deal with those cases, we add an ÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÅoverlappedÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÂ category, which includes individuals with a major field of study in one of these 170 categories.
